headline: Alibaba Teams With China’s Nuclear Leader to Power AI Expansion
summary: Alibaba this week established a 250 million yuan ($35.9 million) joint venture with China National Nuclear Power Co. and several other partners, according to data on corporate database Tianyancha.  The registration documents outlined areas of cooperation including energy generation, but didn’t specify the exact scope of their partnership or operations.  Alibaba representatives didn’t immediately respond to requests for comment.

Alibaba representatives didn’t immediately respond to requests for comment.

headline: Oklo Upgraded Days After This Cathie Wood Buy Amid Meta Deal Excitement
summary: Nuclear startup Oklo was handed a bullish upgrade before Wednesday's stock market open based on a previously announced binding agreement with Facebook-parent Meta Platforms  to develop a 1.2 gigawatt advanced nuclear campus.  Bank of America analysts on Wednesday upgraded Oklo upgraded to buy from neutral with a price target of 127, up from 111.  The analysts decided to upgrade Oklo after the advance nuclear technology company on Jan. 9 announced a deal with Meta that "advances" its development of a 1.2 gigawatt campus in Pike County, Ohio.

The analysts decided to upgrade Oklo after the advance nuclear technology company on Jan. 9 announced a deal with Meta that "advances" its development of a 1.2 gigawatt campus in Pike County, Ohio.

headline: Treasury Yield Spike Can’t Be Ignored. Stocks Are Vulnerable to ‘Sell America’ Pressures.
summary: The current turmoil in global bond markets, which has triggered a spike in U.S. Treasury yields and a record slump in Japan, could have big implications for stock markets heading into a crucial early stretch of the new year.  President Donald Trump’s vow to take over Greenland “one way or the other,” as well as his new tariff threats on European allies and the ongoing pressure on Federal Reserve independence, has stoked a new phase of the so-called Sell America trade in bond markets that spilled over violently into stocks on the first day of the holiday-shortened week.  The bond market slump Tuesday, which was accelerated by a looming fiscal crisis in Japan as the country heads toward a snap national election next month, lifted benchmark  10-year Treasury note  yields just past 4.3%, the highest since August 2025.

content.title: Treasury Yield Spike Can’t Be Ignored. Stocks Are Vulnerable to ‘Sell America’ Pressures.
content.summary: The current turmoil in global bond markets, which has triggered a spike in U.S. Treasury yields and a record slump in Japan, could have big implications for stock markets heading into a crucial early stretch of the new year.  President Donald Trump’s vow to take over Greenland “one way or the other,” as well as his new tariff threats on European allies and the ongoing pressure on Federal Reserve independence, has stoked a new phase of the so-called Sell America trade in bond markets that spilled over violently into stocks on the first day of the holiday-shortened week.  The bond market slump Tuesday, which was accelerated by a looming fiscal crisis in Japan as the country heads toward a snap national election next month, lifted benchmark  10-year Treasury note  yields just past 4.3%, the highest since August 2025.

headline: AI is 'massive': Trump discusses energy expansions at Davos
summary: "How do you spend $50 billion?" President Trump asked when discussing Meta Platforms' (META) plans for an AI data center project at the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos, Switzerland, on Wednesday. The US leader went on to comment on the outlook for Big Tech's power generation for these AI plants. Watch President Trump's full World Economic Forum address.

content.title: AI is 'massive': Trump discusses energy expansions at Davos
content.description:
"How do you spend $50 billion?" President Trump asked when discussing Meta Platforms' (META) plans for an AI data center project at the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos, Switzerland, on Wednesday. The US leader went on to comment on the outlook for Big Tech's power generation for these AI plants.

Watch President Trump's full World Economic Forum address.

headline: 2026’s Biggest AI Trends: The Rise of AI Factories | VRT Stock, NVT Stock, MOD Stock
summary: 24/7 Wall St. Analysts Eric Bleeker and Austin Smith are kicking the New Year off in style with 12 trends for AI investors to watch in 2026. Over the course of 12 videos, the two will share their thoughts on everything from the memory explosion to software stocks to robotics. In this video, Eric takes a deeper look at the rise of AI factories, massive data centers with a capacity of more than 1 gigawatt. As Eric notes, it's not just Oracle's Stargate getting into the race. There are also new super factories from Microsoft, Amazon, Meta, and many others. Companies with data center cooling portfolios like Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), nVent Electric (NYSE: NVT), Modine Manufacturing (NYSE: MOD) could be winners as the construction of this new generation of data centers takes off.

content.title: 2026’s Biggest AI Trends: The Rise of AI Factories | VRT Stock, NVT Stock, MOD Stock
content.description:
24/7 Wall St. Analysts Eric Bleeker and Austin Smith are kicking the New Year off in style with 12 trends for AI investors to watch in 2026. Over the course of 12 videos, the two will share their thoughts on everything from the memory explosion to software stocks to robotics.

In this video, Eric takes a deeper look at the rise of AI factories, massive data centers with a capacity of more than 1 gigawatt. As Eric notes, it's not just Oracle's Stargate getting into the race. There are also new super factories from Microsoft, Amazon, Meta, and many others. 

Companies with data center cooling portfolios like Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), nVent Electric (NYSE: NVT), Modine Manufacturing (NYSE: MOD) could be winners as the construction of this new generation of data centers takes off.
content.summary: 24/7 Wall St. Analysts Eric Bleeker and Austin Smith are kicking the New Year off in style with 12 trends for AI investors to watch in 2026. Over the course of 12 videos, the two will share their thoughts on everything from the memory explosion to software stocks to robotics. In this video, Eric takes a deeper look at the rise of AI factories, massive data centers with a capacity of more than 1 gigawatt. As Eric notes, it's not just Oracle's Stargate getting into the race. There are also new super factories from Microsoft, Amazon, Meta, and many others. Companies with data center cooling portfolios like Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), nVent Electric (NYSE: NVT), Modine Manufacturing (NYSE: MOD) could be winners as the construction of this new generation of data centers takes off.

headline: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella Warns AI Could Lose 'Social Permission' If It Burns Energy Without Real-World Benefits In Health And Education
summary: Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) CEO Satya Nadella says artificial intelligence faces a test: prove it improves people's lives or risk losing public trust. Speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, on Tuesday in a wide-ranging discussion with BlackRock (NYSE:BLK) CEO Larry Fink, Nadella said AI's massive energy use will only be tolerated if it delivers tangible results in areas like health care, education and productivity. “We will quickly lose even the social permission to actually tak

content.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella Warns AI Could Lose 'Social Permission' If It Burns Energy Without Real-World Benefits In Health And Education
content.summary: Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) CEO Satya Nadella says artificial intelligence faces a test: prove it improves people's lives or risk losing public trust. Speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, on Tuesday in a wide-ranging discussion with BlackRock (NYSE:BLK) CEO Larry Fink, Nadella said AI's massive energy use will only be tolerated if it delivers tangible results in areas like health care, education and productivity. “We will quickly lose even the social permission to actually tak

headline: Nearly 400 millionaires and billionaires across 24 countries are demanding Davos leaders tax them more: ‘Tax us. Tax the super rich.’
summary: As the world’s wealthiest touch down in Davos for the World Economic Forum, hundreds of the ultra-rich—including the Disney heirs and millionaire real estate developer Jeffrey Gural—call on leaders to end the “control” of global oligarchs with taxes.
